page.title: 08SOCIAL ACTIVITIES IN PENNARD
page.content: THE GOLDEN AGE CLUB WAS FORMED IN 1975, TO PROVIDE SOCIAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER PEOPLE. IT HAS FORTY-TWO MEMBERS OVER SIXTY-FIVE YEARS OLD, AND MEETS TWICE A MONTH. DEMONSTRATIONS, TALKS AND QUIZ PROGRAMMES ARE HELD, AND MEMBERS OFTEN ENTERTAIN EACH OTHER WITH ONE ACT PLAYS. AN ANNUAL HOLIDAY IS ORGANISED, WHEN MEMBERS TRAVEL BY SPECIAL COACH AND STAY TOGETHER IN THE SAME HOTEL. AS WELL AS COFFEE MORNING THEY ARRANGE GROUP VISITS TO THE THEATRE AND TAKE HALF-DAY AND FULL DAY EXCURSIONS. THE SIXTEEN MEMBERS OF THE LITERATURE GROUP MEET TEN TIMES A YEAR. VISITING SPEAKERS INTRODUCE LITERARY DISCUSSIONS INCLUDING POETRY, NOVELS AND DRAMA. THE RECENTLY FORMED BRANCH OF THE NATIONAL HOUSEWIVES REGISTER HAS FIFTY TWO MEMBERS. WEEKLY INFORMAL MEETINGS IN MEMBERS' HOME COVER A WIDE VARIETY OF TOPICS.
